results.title: Phantom
results.brief_description: This video work is a mysterious, ghostly geography of cinematic shadows. Silhouettes that never quite take shape shift and glide across the screen, anaemic figures, seen in the negative, forced to wander between narratives restlessly but caught in a loop. These remnants from faint memories of filmic melodrama are a living dead confined to a space they cannot leave. They are the secret that lies between stories.

results.title: Jollies
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: An intimate and sardonic work about being an adolescent in mid-American suburbia. From touching the genitals of boys in school to finally getting to kiss the girl she wants, this very funny and accomplished experimental work was filmed while the director was herself a teen.

results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this elegant fictional film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.
Cast: Michael Percival, Lenore Munro, Anthony Cogin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS

results.title: Pleasure domes
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Maggie Fooke
results.brief_description: Is Cannes really like St. Kilda, or is it just a state of mind? Animated watercolour drawings and hand coloured photocopies shape this introspective reflection on the nature of landscape and human responses to it. It hints that our perception of landscape is never direct but always filtered through a set of constructs, either physical or psychological.

results.title: Evictions
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Wendy Lowenstein, Lyn Nicolson and Richard Lowenstein
results.brief_description: Documentary/drama on police-enforced evictions in Melbourne during the 1930’s depression and the tactics the organised unemployed used at the time to combat the situation. Based on the memories of Noel Counihan and Tom Hills and adapted from the book ‘Weevils in the flour’ by Wendy Lowenstein, the film combines interviews with period reconstruction. Erwin Rado Award for Best Australian Short Fiction, Melbourne Film Festival, 1980.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Wendy Lowenstein, Lyn Nicolson and Richard Lowenstein

results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

results.title: Arrivederci Roma
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Richard Zotorski and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: Marinelli (Robert Forza) is a new immigrant to Australia who experiences difficulties when confronted with the harshness of the Anglo-saxon culture during a swimming lesson. With an inability to speak English, Marinelli is plunged into the deep end of the pool and cultural survival. Directed by Geoffrey Wright known mostly for ‘Romper Stomper’ and ‘Metal Skin’. Set in the City Baths, Melbourne.

results.title: And the lighthouse made three
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A plasticene animated film about a lonely lighthouse, a craggy old lighthouse keeper and a mysterious dark figure that moves in the fog. A delightful song ends this tale of unrequited love.

results.title: Drift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and black and white, silent
results.brief_description: Since the first Apollo moon landing in the 1960s, NASA has compiled an enormous photographic record of its lunar saga. San Francisco photographer Michael Light gained access to the original negatives, presenting his collection of photography in major American and European museums including San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. As a reprise to his photographic exhibition ‘Full Moon’, Light has created ‘Drift’, an epic seven-minute loop of composite still imagery taken during NASA’s moon missions.
